page.title: 13ANTIQUES BY THE TYNE
page.content: In the{Royal Industrial Estate}east of Banks of the Tyne, we discovered a unit in which 3{craftsmen}restored furniture (Mr Taylor, Mr Zuckerman and Mr Young). One of the{antiques}was an eight feet tall grandfather clock. It was made in the early 1800's. Mr Zuckerman was mending a chair. He was putting horse hair and cloth on and stitching it down a special way. Mr Taylor told us the firm received work from one end of Britain to the other. One job he was busy with was for a man from Jersey. A difficulty, said Mr Zuckerman, was finding young persons who were prepared to patiently learn the required skills of antique restoration, to keep the craft alive.
